derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, literally we command'

means.word_mean: 1. an extraordinary writ commanding an official to perform a ministerial act that the law recognizes as an absolute duty and not a matter for the official's discretion; used only when all other judicial remedies fail
